comments:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: 200412210800
WebTools 1.0 M2

When you open a file in a Jar file with the Web browser editor a
NullPointerException is thrown.  This is because it returns JarEntryEditorInput
not the expected IWebBrowserEditorInput.

This piece of code from WebBrowserEditor#createPartControl could never work if
input is null (which it is in this case)

if (input == null || input.isToolbarVisible() == false)
    webBrowser = new WebBrowser(parent, false, input.isStatusbarVisible());
else {
...

Fixed the error. It should now show an error message when trying to open the 
file and not throw a NPE.

I wasn't entirely sure from your comments whether you thought the browser 
should actually work on compressed files. If this is the case, then please 
open an enhancement request. We would have to extract the file from the 
archive first and then point the browser to it. This may work, but there would 
be a number of pitfalls like showing the wrong URL or (on some platforms) 
editing the wrong file.

Null check removed, and a runtime exception is thrown from the 
getWebBrowserEditorInput() method if the input is invalid to be clear where 
the problem is

Created an attachment (id=23997)
Browser error

Verified that the NPE has gone away, but the error message given to the user is
quite cryptic.	See attached screenshot.
Reopening to fix now that the browser has moved into the platform.
